actions.committee: House Committee on Ways and Means
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Ways and Means.

official_title: A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1954 to extend to all unmarried individuals the full tax benefits of income splitting now enjoyed by married individuals filing joint returns, and to remove rate inequities for married persons where both are employed.
short_title: Marital Status Tax Equity Act of 1979

summary.text: Marital Status Tax Equity Act of 1979 - Amends the Internal Revenue Code to provide identical income tax rates for single persons, heads of households, and married couples filing jointly or separately. Establishes the zero bracket amount at $3,400 for all individual taxpayers. Sets forth rules for the eligibility of surviving spouses for income averaging.

titles.title: Marital Status Tax Equity Act of 1979

A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1954 to extend to all unmarried individuals the full tax benefits of income splitting now enjoyed by married individuals filing joint returns, and to remove rate inequities for married persons where both are employed.
